CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 1, 1954, pg. 17, reads: "Heagy - Spalding Inquest Scenes - Says Spalding Beaten - Norman Johns (extreme right) testified Wednesday that a lieutenant imposed his rank on a turnkey to enter a cell and beat Spalding the day of Spalding's death. Johns at the time was in same cell block with Spalding and (left to right) Ben Nesbitt of 1205 Epiphany Street, and William Grimes of Wylie Avenue. - All Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Ben Nesbitt, William Grimes, and Norman Johns wearing pinstriped suit, seated in interior at Heagy - Spalding inquest
